channel.title: 'Mendacious Nitwits' :: Unofficial-Official Moparscape Capture the Flag Team
channel.description:
I decided we should enter 32C3's Capture the Flag this year, so I registered a team - 'Mendacious Nitwits'. Sorry, mdog, you will never live it down...
You can find out more about 32C3's contest here: https://32c3ctf.ccc.ac/announcements/
If you're not familiar with ctf, essentially they are hacking/information security challenges - a little like the one I posted that I made a few months ago, except actually well-run and entertaining, because these guys know how to make a challenge fun.
Winning qualifies the team for Defcon 2016 in Las Vegas. It runs from the 27th Dec, for 48 hours, and the aim is to get as many points as we can in the 48 hours. More points = higher on the leaderboard.
32C3 is a jeopardy style challenge, which means we will receive a bunch of 'hints' on the 27th. For example, one may be a link to a web service with a hint on some flaw that lets us break into it, one may be an executable running on a remote server we have to write an exploit for, etc. Usually, a wide variety of skillsets is covered, so if you're hopeless at writing shellcode but are really good at breaking web apps, or know your way around Java bytecode or crypto or anything really, you are probably going to find something to spend time on. Absolute newcomers are totally welcome, as long as your mindset is 'I am going to try to figure this shit out' and not 'I am going to complain as soon as I hit something I don't understand'.
You can find the team here, PM me for the invite code: https://ctftime.org/team/21200
[b]Bring your best boolean lag handlers and clinet.java.[/b]

item.title: 'Mendacious Nitwits' :: Unofficial-Official Moparscape Capture the Flag Team
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:18, topic:554150”]OK, in that case I guess I’ll forgive you.

It was basically an epic fail, a quick 150 pts and then I got discouraged by nobody showing up, did half of some of the others, planned to finish them the next day and didn’t.

Bowser isn’t forgiven though as he didn’t socialise either.[/quote]
That’s OK, I’ve still not forgiven you for the Royal Mail, even if you had nothing to do with the decision.

Read full topic
item.source: 'Mendacious Nitwits' :: Unofficial-Official Moparscape Capture the Flag Team

item.title: 'Mendacious Nitwits' :: Unofficial-Official Moparscape Capture the Flag Team
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Another good way to ‘prepare’ as it were would be to google writeups of previous C3’s - ‘31C3 ctf writeup’ ‘30c3 ctf writeup’ etc - usually not every challenge is covered as people are too busy hacking and not blogging, but it gives you a good idea of the sorts of challenges that will be used.

Ultimately though… it WILL be challenging, especially if you haven’t done a ctf before. that’s OK though - it’s meant to be. It’s not the hardest ctf on the calendar (look at writesup of say, Ghost in the Shellcode, jeez) but it isn’t a walk in the park noobfest either. I fully expect us to pick up a few points, but we would probably exceed everyones expectations if we scored say, top 30. If that sets the tone any better for anyone?

S’all a bit of fun though.

edit: and, ofc justaguy - just create yourselves accounts on ctftime and join the team (link in OP). Will add you when I see it.

Read full topic
item.source: 'Mendacious Nitwits' :: Unofficial-Official Moparscape Capture the Flag Team
